title: North Elmham Walks

images.title: Fireplace at the Chapel/Castle by Ashley Dace, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Fireplace at the Chapel-Castle. The earthworks and ruins are believed to be the remains of Bishop Herbert de Losinga's late 11th-century episcopal church and the late 14th-century double-moated castle built on this by Henry le Despenser, Bishop of Norwich. Henry came from a powerful family who had strong connections with the House of Plantagenet and the notorious 'favourites' of King Edward II.

images.title: Adrian Hodge / Wensum meadows
images.caption: Wensum meadows. From the edge of Bintree Woods, meadows lead down to the River Wensum, with North Elmham church visible in the distance.

images.title: Paul Shreeve / Trackbed, North Elmham
images.caption: This is the trackbed of the Great Eastern Railway at North Elmham, looking towards County School. The 1 mile of trackbed between the current line and the station plus the actual County School station was bought off the council for the huge expense of £1 a few years ago to aid the extension progress.

images.title: North Elmham Chapel/Castle by Ashley Dace, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: North Elmham Chapel-Castle

images.title: Paul Shreeve / Railway Bridge, GER, North Elmham
images.caption: Railway Bridge, GER. The good state of the trackbed and bridges over it show why the Mid Norfolk Railway hope to be able to extend their track from Dereham to County School, and one day to join on to the North Norfolk Railway, too.

images.title: River Wensum North Elmham by David Leeming, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: River Wensum North Elmham

images.title: Alex Noel-Tod / St Mary, North Elmham
images.caption: St Mary, North Elmham. View looking south from top of church tower. Cathedral Drive and Brookside estate in middle distance.

images.title: Zorba the Geek / Cricket match at North Elmham
images.caption: Cricket match at North Elmham. In the low light of the evening sun, a supporter watches as the bowler comes in to bowl yet another ball at this pitch at the cross-roads in the village. Old ways survive.

description: This pretty Norfolk village is located near Swanton Morley on the western bank of the River Wensum . The village is noted for the ancient ruins of a Norman Chapel on the site of an even earlier Anglo Saxon timber cathedral. This walk explores the English Heritage owned chapel grounds which are located just to the north of the village. You can follow paths around the site before heading east to pick up the trackbed of the Great Eastern Railway next to the River Wensum Meadows. To continue your walking in the area you could pick up the Walsingham Way . The long distance route takes you from the historic abbey in Great Walsingham to the city of Norwich . If you follow it south east it will take you along the River Wensum to neighbouring Swanton Morley where you will find a noteworthy 14th century church and an early 17th century pub with links to the ancestors of Abraham Lincoln.
